topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.0: Deploy the Log Rotate Patch

body.section: This patch fixes a problem with the RabbitMQ service installed on HP Helion OpenStack CarrierGrade. RabbitMQ was consuming excessive memory. After deploying this patch, the Elasticsearch service's memory will be set to 50% of free memory. If the free memory exceeds 32g then the memory will be set to 32g as per the Elasticsearch guidelines. In addition, this patch includes a script file that will delete logstash logs greater than 8 days old..

Download the patch
If you have not downloaded the patch, launch the Helion Distribution Network (HDN). You must obtain a user account on HDN in order to download these files. In a browser, navigate to Helion Download Network(HDN).
Click Sign In to log in using your account.
After signing in, click the Downloads link in the menu on the left side of the page.
Download the patch and the associated checksum and signature files.
Verify the downloaded signature and the downloaded checksums.
Extract the compressed files until the knc-log.rotate.patch and readme files are available.
The README with the patch download contains information on files changed by these patches.

ol.li:
Log onto the lifecycle manager VM.ssh <HLM_VM_IP>
where: HLM_VM_IP is the CLM IP of the lifecycle manager. Locate the IP address for the lifecycle manager in the /root/infra-ansible-playbooks/group_vars/all file under hlm_clmstaticip field.
Copy the file to the /root/ directory.
Execute the following command to deploy the patch: patch -p1 < ../knc-log.rotate.patch
Execute the following command to integrate the changes into the environment:./hlm_prepare-env.sh
Execute the following command:hlm generate -c <cloud name>

Execute the following command to redeploy the Horizon UI:
For Sacramento deployments:hlm deploy -c <cloud name> -t "ATTIS BVR-LOG ELK-SCH FND-MDB IC2-WEB SWF-CMN FND-CLU NEU-API DCN-NEU ML2-SRIOV NEU-API-BAR Conclude"
For Memphis and Tahoe deployments:hlm deploy -c <cloud name> -t "ATTIS BVR-LOG ELK-SCH FND-MDB IC2-WEB SWF-CMN FND-CLU NEU-API DCN-NEU ML2-SRIOV Conclude"
For Denver deployments:hlm deploy -c <cloud name> -t "ATTIS BVR-LOG ELK-SCH FND-MDB IC2-WEB SWF-CMN FND-CLU Conclude"
